questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to use dynamic content within their emails to provide customers with more personalized communications. This includes using a Dynamic Sender Profile to customize the From Name and From Email Address to use the regional store manager's information. If a new manager is assigned to a region, NTO only wants to update the information in one place.
What data should a consultant ensure exists within Marketing Cloud in order to facilitate this?

choices.D: Region code, regional store manager's name, and email address for each customer.
choices.C: Regional store manager's name and email address for each customer.
choices.A: Each customer's region code and the manager's name and email address for each region code.
choices.B: Name and email address for each regional store manager stored on a lookup table.

discussion.content: Confused between option A and D, isn't D?

comments.content: We don't need the data for each customer; just for each region code is enough.

comments.content: The personlazation strings relates only the content from sendable data extension. Following the best practice of SFMC, we do not add mail content to the sendable data extensions.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters assigns a 15-digit integer as their Order ID which will be used as the primary key of a data extension. The import file contains leading zeroes, but they will NOT be included in the final values.
Which data type should they use for the Order ID field?
Which two statements are accurate regarding segmentation options in Marketing Cloud? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: AC - you can not update a random data extension with a filter activity

Selected Answer: AB
it is AB
Guys, really thought that B would also be possible. I've just populated a filtered data extension using a filter activity.

Selected Answer: AC
AC, I think

choices.C: A data filter can be automated with a filter activity
choices.A: A data extension can be updated using a query activity
choices.B: A filtered data extension can be populated with a filter activity
choices.D: A random data extension can be updated with a filter activity

choices.A: Configure link wrapping to redirect to the business unit's subdomain
choices.B: Configure custom Reply Mail Management for the business unit's subdomain
choices.D: Route the domain through an IP address unique to the business unit
choices.C: Delegate a specific subdomain to the Marketing Cloud name servers

discussion.content: B is not necessary to be configured to the subdomain only. However, you need the subdomain pointed to SFMC before you can complete any other step with SAP and hence C is correct.
c - you need the subdomain pointed to SFMC before you can complete any other step with SAP.
c - The first thing to do is delegate a subdomain or domain
